Structs/Thread.html#/s:22AzureCommunicat.name: createdOn
Structs/Thread.html#/s:22AzureCommunicat.abstract: The timestamp when the thread was created. The timestamp is in RFC3339 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Structs/Thread.html#/s:22AzureCommunicat.name: deletedOn
Structs/Thread.html#/s:22AzureCommunicat.abstract: The timestamp when the thread was deleted. The timestamp is in RFC3339 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Structs/ReadReceipt.html#/s:22AzureCommu.name: chatMessageId
Structs/ReadReceipt.html#/s:22AzureCommu.abstract: Id of the message that has been read. This id is generated by the server.

Structs/ReadReceipt.html#/s:22AzureCommu.name: readOn
Structs/ReadReceipt.html#/s:22AzureCommu.abstract: The time at which the message was read. The timestamp is in RFC3339 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Structs/Participant.html#/s:22AzureCommu.name: shareHistoryTime
Structs/Participant.html#/s:22AzureCommu.abstract: Time from which the chat history is shared with the participant. The timestamp is in RFC3339 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Structs/Message.html#/s:22AzureCommunica.name: sequenceId

Structs/Message.html#/s:22AzureCommunica.name: senderDisplayName
Structs/Message.html#/s:22AzureCommunica.abstract: The display name of the message sender. This property is used to populate sender name for push notifications.

Structs/Message.html#/s:22AzureCommunica.name: deletedOn
Structs/Message.html#/s:22AzureCommunica.abstract: The timestamp (if applicable) when the message was deleted. The timestamp is in RFC3339 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Structs/Message.html#/s:22AzureCommunica.name: editedOn
Structs/Message.html#/s:22AzureCommunica.abstract: The last timestamp (if applicable) when the message was edited. The timestamp is in RFC3339 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Classes/Chat/CreateChatThreadOptions.htm.name: repeatabilityRequestID
Classes/Chat/CreateChatThreadOptions.htm.abstract: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-ID and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-ID is an opaque string representing a client-generated, globally unique for all time, identifier for the request. It is recommended to use version 4 (random) UUIDs.
